question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
If $\frac{\sqrt{x}}{\sqrt{x-1}}=\frac32$, solve for $x$. Express your answer in simplest fractional form.
inference:
$$\frac{\sqrt{x}}{\sqrt{x-1}}=\frac32$$

$$\Rightarrow 2\sqrt{x}=3\sqrt{x-1}$$

$$\Rightarrow 4x=9(x-1)$$

$$\Rightarrow 4x=9x-9$$

$$\Rightarrow 5x=9$$

$$\Rightarrow x=\frac95$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac95}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
We can start by cross-multiplying: \begin{align*} 3\sqrt{x-1}&=2\sqrt{x}
\\\Rightarrow \qquad (3\sqrt{x-1})^2 &=(2\sqrt{x})^2
\\\Rightarrow \qquad 9(x-1)& =4(x)
\\\Rightarrow \qquad 9x-9& =4x
\\ \Rightarrow \qquad5x&=9
\\ \Rightarrow \qquad x&=\boxed{\frac9{5}}.
\end{align*}Checking, we see that this value of $x$ does indeed work, so it is not an extraneous solution.
